meta.title: Palmyra-Eagle Area School District - PEASD COVID-19 Updates

link.title: PEASD COVID-19 Updates - Palmyra-Eagle Area School District
PEASD COVID-19 Updates - Palmyra-Eagle Area School District
PEASD COVID-19 Updates - Palmyra-Eagle Area School District
PEASD COVID-19 Updates - Palmyra-Eagle Area School District

div.p:
Please be advised that the Governor has extended the "Safer at Home" order through May 26, 2020. In addition to this recent order, all schools will be closed through the conclusion of the current academic year. This is not the news that we wanted to hear, but will plan accordingly in light of this determination. District staff will be meeting to plan for this recent news and once plans are developed you can expect communications to you for your planning purposes. Principals will be speaking with their staff members to make appropriate plans for the continuation of learning opportunities to the extent possible. We ask your patience in taking the time necessary to process this new information and the impact that it has on your child(ren) and your family. There will certainly be more information to follow. Dr. Steven M. Bloom, District Administrator
Palmyra-Eagle Area School District

span.a: You are currently on this page - PEASD COVID-19 Updates

span.span: In spite of schools being closed due to the COVID-19 pandemic and Governor Evers “Safer at Home” order, employees of the Palmyra-Eagle Area School District remain engaged in various activities to support our students and their families during these trying times. A huge note of thanks and appreciation to our maintenance and custodial staff members for their deep cleaning of our schools and to our food service staff members for the preparation of meals made available to anyone under the age of 18 on a weekday basis. Pick up has begun recently at both Eagle

Elementary School and P-E High School from 11:00 AM to 12:30 PM. (Note: Due to the previously scheduled no school days there will be no food service on Friday, April 10 or Monday, April 13 at either location).

Kudos to our administrative staff members for their communications with students and families and for the support they have provided to teachers and clerical and instructional staff members who have worked to provide communications to, and continuation of learning opportunities for, our students as the school closure was implemented and then extended through April 24th. At this time, it is unknown if the order is to be extended.

Should the mandatory closures be lifted the PEASD will stand prepared and ready to once again welcome students into our classrooms and schools. Until that time, please remain safe, practice “social distancing” when in public settings, and take the opportunity to pause and reflect upon the gift of time provided to you in this unprecedented time.

p.span: On Monday, March 30th, school lunches will once again be available at no charge, to any person in our community under the age of 18, Monday through Friday. We will now make lunches available at two pick-up sites: Palmyra-Eagle MS/HS, door #14 (across from the track) and Eagle Elementary School, door #7 (on the side of the building). Pick up times will be from 11:00 - 12:30 at each site. Keep in mind, that April 10th and April 13th were previously scheduled days off, so no lunch will be available on those days. Please contact Annette Kozlowski at 262-495-7101 ext. 2414 or akozlowski@peasd.org with any questions. Thank you - hope to see you for lunch.
Notice to parents of a student with an IEP during school closure:

The guidance from the US Department of Education clarifies that if a school provides services through virtual learning during a time of school closure, the school must ensure that students with disabilities have equal access to the same opportunities and that to the greatest extent possible, special education and related services are provided under IDEA or a plan developed under Section 504.

During this time of closure your child will receive their special education services using online or virtual instruction, instructional telephone calls, and other curriculum-based instructional activities. Your child’s teacher or therapists will be reaching out to you to communicate the plan for your child. Because the needs of each student are different, the teachers will be developing individual plans that are designed to best meet a student’s specific needs. We recognize that not all students have the necessary technology or means to participate in instruction using an online platform. Therefore, if for any reason, your child is not able to participate in instruction virtually or through other means, please contact your child’s teacher to discuss other options that may be considered to provide instruction during the time of closure.

If for any reason it is not possible to provide instruction to your child during a closure, your child’s IEP team (or appropriate personnel under Section 504) will make an individualized determination whether and to what extent compensatory services may be needed, consistent with applicable requirements, including to make up for any skills that may have been lost. The IEP team would reconvene once school reopens and hold IEP meetings to make this determination.

The purpose of the state of Wisconsin closing schools is to provide social-distancing to prevent the transmission of COVID-19. For this reason, district staff will not be providing in-person/at-home services. This is for the protection of teachers as well as students and their families.

We are committed to making this experience a valuable and positive one for your child(ren). The best way to reach me during this time is by email. Thank you, and best wishes to your family in the upcoming weeks.

Julie Preman,
Interim Director of Special Education and Pupil Services

td.h3: Talking Points for Children-Parent Guide to COVID-19

p.span: Good morning everyone. Thank you once again for your support and patience during this unprecedented time in our schools.

All staff members in the Palmyra-Eagle Area School District hold the safety of students and others first and foremost in the daily execution of assigned duties and expectations. The unique challenge presented to the general public and the order to close all schools announced recently will only serve, once again, to bring all district employees together to plan for and provide a safe learning environment and continuity of learning experiences for our students during the closure.

As a reminder, at this time all schools in the PEASD will be closed through Friday, April 3. It is anticipated that all schools will re-open on Monday, April 6. During the time of school closings there will be no activities, events, or meetings as previously scheduled. Additionally, no outside groups will be permitted to make use of any school during the duration of the closure.

Here is a link to "Talking to Children About COVID-19" parent resource that you might find useful in your discussion with your child(ren) about this matter. It is hoped that you find the information of use and comfort.
In the meantime, district communications will be sent when additional information becomes available.
Thank you once again for your understanding during this trying time.
Dr. Steven M. Bloom, PEASD District Administrator
